property.name: text
property.value:
When the switch is closed, if the current through the load is provided as an input, then the output voltage to the load will be provided.
If instead the voltage at the load is provided as an input, then the current through the load will be provided as an output.

property.name: text
property.value: The open input is ignored here.

property.name: text
property.value: When the switch is open, the input is ignored, and the output is a constant zero current to the load. The output voltage is not specified (it will be absent).

property.name: text
property.value: When the diode is reverse biased, the input is the voltage across the diode, which is equal to the voltage across the inductor. The output is the current through the inductor. If no input w is provided, the output voltage will be absent.

property.name: text
property.value: NOTE: Could have a leakage current here.

property.name: text
property.value: When the diode is forward biased, the input voltage is ignored because the diode forces the voltage to equal the forward bias voltage.

property.name: text
property.value: The current through the diode is equal to the current through the inductor minus the current provided by the input.
